titleStmt.title: To M. Bavv-vvavv Health, with increase of mirth and merrie conceites.

publicationStmt.publisher: To the Reader: The English Preface in Print, c. 1475-1640 / Early English Books Online Text Creation Partnership

analytic.title: To M. Bavv-vvavv Health, with increase of mirth and merrie conceites.

monogr.title: A pil to purge melancholie: or, a preprative to a purgation: or, topping, copping, and capping : take either or whether: or, mash them, and squash them, and dash them, and diddle come derrie come daw them, all together

keywords.term: Adages, aphorisms, emblem books, jests, proverbs

div.head: To M. Bavv-vvavv Health, with increase of mirth and merrie conceites.
div.p: MAister Baw-waw, as one vnknowne, yet mooued through affection, as also hearing of your arriuall into England, I haue made bolde to dedicate this my simple labor vnto you; to be shrowded, sheilded, and defended by your indifferent censure, you beeing a Spirit all compoz'de of mirth and merrie conceite: And although it may seeme but a toy, yet being read, may refrigerate your senses tossed and weeried with the tedious trauell of forraine Countries, as also stirre vp a hart plunged in melancholie, and adde alacritie to a minde disposed to mirth. Thus, not knowing how I may well commend it, I referre it (as before) by you to be censured.
